languages.text: "Благодарю, шерин. Впрочем, главные из них — чтение и письмо. Возможно, вам это невдомек, но для миллиардов имперцев это непостижимая наука — без которой, впрочем, они прекрасно обходятся на своих пожизненных постах на заводах, плантациях и сборочных линиях. Я? Я не для того удрала с Ифрита, чтобы обречь себя на подобное прозябание. И именно грамотность открыла мне дорогу к скопированным приказам, фальшивым подписям, подложным документам... всему тому, что заставляет вращать бюрократические машины в верном направлении".

"Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."
languages.original_text: "Благодарю, шерин. Впрочем, главные из них — чтение и письмо. Возможно, вам это невдомек, но для миллиардов имперцев это непостижимая наука — без которой, впрочем, они прекрасно обходятся на своих пожизненных постах на заводах, плантациях и сборочных линиях. Я? Я не для того удрала с Ифрита, чтобы обречь себя на подобное прозябание. И именно грамотность открыла мне дорогу к скопированным приказам, фальшивым подписям, подложным документам... всему тому, что заставляет вращать бюрократические машины в верном направлении".

You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of Imperial subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved me a path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy spin in the right direction."

languages.text: “谢谢你，亲爱的。在这其中，阅读与写作的能力是最重要的。或许你没意识到，帝国几十亿臣民都没有这样的能力，而他们却开开心心地在他们的工厂、农田、装配线上埋头苦干。至于我呢？我逃出艾弗里特，并不是为了让自己过上这样的苦日子。是识字的能力为我铺平了未来的道路，让我得以伪造命令、签名与文件……正是这些美妙的东西，让官僚机构的巨轮朝着正确的方向转动。”
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: “谢谢你，亲爱的。在这其中，阅读与写作的能力是最重要的。或许你没意识到，帝国几十亿臣民都没有这样的能力，而他们却开开心心地在他们的工厂、农田、装配线上埋头苦干。至于我呢？我逃出艾弗里特，并不是为了让自己过上这样的苦日子。是识字的能力为我铺平了未来的道路，让我得以伪造命令、签名与文件……正是这些美妙的东西，让官僚机构的巨轮朝着正确的方向转动。”
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

languages.text: «Gracias, shereen. Poder leer y escribir es lo más importante. Tal vez no lo sepa, pero este conocimiento está más allá de las capacidades de billones de súbditos del Imperium que, sin embargo, siguen trabajando felizmente en sus fábricas, fundiciones y líneas de montaje. ¿Yo? Yo no escapé de Efreet para conformarme con esa miseria de vida. Fue la alfabetización lo que allanó mi camino hacia las órdenes copiadas, firmas falsificadas, documentos adulterados... las maravillas que aseguran que los engranajes de la burocracia giran en el sentido correcto».
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: «Gracias, shereen. Poder leer y escribir es lo más importante. Tal vez n lo sepa, pero este conocimiento está más allá de las capacidades de billones de súbditos imperiales que, sin embargo, siguen trabajando felizmente en sus fábricas, fundiciones y líneas de montaje. ¿Yo? Yo no escapé de Efreet para conformarme con esa miseria de vida. Fue la alfabetización lo que levantó mi puente hacia las órdenes copiadas, firmas falsificadas, documentos adulterados... las maravillas que aseguran que los engranajes de la burocracia giran en el sentido correcto».
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.text: 「ありがとう、シャリーン。読み書きができることは、その最たるものよ。あんたは知らないかもしれないけど、この科学は何十億という帝国の臣民…未だに工場や組立ラインでの作業を喜んで続けている連中の能力を超えているのさ。あたし？あたしはイフリートから逃れてきたわけじゃあないの。コピーされた命令、偽造されたサイン、偽造された書類…官僚主義の歯車を正しい方向に回転させる素晴らしいものよ」
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: 「ありがとう、シャリーン。読み書きができることは、その最たるものよ。あんたは知らないかもしれないけど、この科学は何十億という帝国の臣民…未だに工場や組立ラインでの作業を喜んで続けている連中の能力を超えているのさ。あたし？あたしはイフリートから逃れてきたわけじゃあないの。コピーされた命令、偽造されたサイン、偽造された書類…官僚主義の歯車を正しい方向に回転させる素晴らしいものよ」
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.text: "Danke, Shereen. Lesen und schreiben zu können ist das größte davon. Ihr wisst das vielleicht noch nicht, doch diese Wissenschaft übersteigt die Fähigkeiten von Milliarden von Untertanen des Imperiums — und doch schuften sie weiter glücklich in ihren Fabriken und an ihren Fließbändern. Ich? Ich bin nicht von Efreet geflohen, um mir solchem Elend auszusetzen. Die Fähigkeit zu lesen hat mir den Weg geebnet zu kopierten Befehlen, gefälschten Unterschriften, fingierten Dokumenten ... Zu all den wunderbaren Dingen, durch die sich die Räder der Bürokratie in die richtige Richtung drehen."
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: "Danke, Shereen. Lesen und schreiben zu können ist das größte davon. Ihr wisst das vielleicht noch nicht, doch diese Wissenschaft übersteigt die Fähigkeiten von Milliarden von Untertanen des Imperiums — und doch schuften sie weiter glücklich in ihren Fabriken und an ihren Fließbändern. Ich? Ich bin nicht von Efreet geflohen, um mir solchem Elend auszusetzen. Die Fähigkeit zu lesen hat mir den Weg geebnet zu kopierten Befehlen, gefälschten Unterschriften, fingierten Dokumenten ... Zu all den wunderbaren Dingen, durch die sich die Räder der Bürokratie in die richtige Richtung drehen."
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.text: « Merci, shereen. Je considère que la lecture et l'écriture sont parmi les plus importants. Vous l'ignorez peut-être, mais ces aptitudes sont comme une science impénétrable aux yeux de milliards de sujets de l'Imperium, qui se contentent de trimer dans leurs usines, plantations et chaînes de montage. Un espion ? Je n'ai pas fui Éfrit pour me cantonner dans une vie aussi misérable. C'est en apprenant à lire et à écrire que je me suis mise sur la voie des ordres altérés, des signatures falsifiées, des documents contrefaits... Toutes ces choses merveilleuses qui font tourner les roues de la bureaucratie dans la bonne direction. »
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: « Merci, shereen. Je considère que la lecture et l'écriture sont parmi les plus importants. Vous l'ignorez peut-être, mais ces aptitudes sont comme une science impénétrable aux yeux de milliards de sujets impériaux, qui se contentent de trimer dans leurs usines, plantations et chaînes de montage. Moi, en revanche, je n'ai pas fui Éfrit pour me cantonner dans une vie aussi misérable. C'est en apprenant à lire et à écrire que je me suis mise sur la voie des ordres altérés, des signatures falsifiées, des documents contrefaits... Toutes ces choses merveilleuses qui font tourner les roues de la bureaucratie dans la bonne direction. »
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion

languages.text: "Teşekkürler şirinim. Bunların içinde en önemlisi de okuma yazma. Farkında olmayabilirsin ama bu, İmparatorluk'un milyarlarca tebaasının kabiliyetlerinin ötesinde bir ilim. Buna rağmen İmparatorluk fabrikalarında, plantasyonlarında ve montaj hatlarında mutlulukla çalışıyorlar. Ya ben? Ben İfrit'ten böyle bir sefalete kurban gitmek için kaçmadım. Okuryazarlık sayesinde emir kopyalama, imza taklit etme, sahte belge düzenleme yolu bana açılmış oldu. Bu harika dümenlerle bürokrasiyi istediğim gibi büküp eğebildim."
languages.original_text: "Thank you, shereen. Being able to read and write is chief among them. You may not be aware, but this science is beyond the abilities of billions of the Imperium's subjects — and yet they happily keep drudging along in their factories, fundi, and assembly lines. Me? I didn't escape Efreet to consign myself to such misery. It was literacy that paved my path to copied orders, forged signatures, counterfeited papers... The wonderful things that make the wheels of bureaucracy turn in the right direction."

traits.locale_text: "Teşekkürler şirinim. Bunların içinde en önemlisi de okuma yazma. Farkında olmayabilirsin ama bu, İmparatorluk'un milyarlarca tebaasının kabiliyetinin ötesinde bir bilim dalı. Buna rağmen İmparatorluk fabrikalarında, funduslarında ve montaj hatlarında mutlulukla çalışıyorlar. Ben? Ben böyle bir sefalete tahammül etmek için Efreet'ten kaçmadım. Okuryazarlık sayesinde emirleri kopyalama, imza taklit etme, sahte belge düzenleme yolu bana açılmış oldu, ki bunlar da bürokrasiyi doğru tarafa döndürmeni sağlayan harikulade dümenlerdir."
traits.speaker: JaeCompanion
